paragraph.value: The entity linking accuracy on the Wikipedia test set are summarized in Table 1. On average, our proposed PBEL method performs

than the baselines, with significant accuracy gains in all nine test languages. The EXACT baseline, which is most often used for monolingual EL (Sil et al. 2017), performs reasonably only when the test language is in the same script as English (i.e., Javanese). Similarly TRANS, the current state-of-the-art retrieval method in cross-lingual EL (Pan et al. 2017), fails when zero data is available in the test language, unless the HRL is very closely-related to the LRL (as with jv, mr and am). On the other hand, ENCODE presents relatively strong zero-shot transfer results. PBEL offers

in BEST-53. However, we see that the Dravidian Telugu (te) seems to obtain
accuracy with Indo-Aryan HRLs – Punjabi (pa) or Hindi (hi). We also see that the Ukrainian (uk) test set has
performance with another Cyrillic script language, Kazakh (kk), rather than Russian (ru).
